thread.title: Fed Is Responsible for Inflated Stock Prices

author: wsjcom
title: Fed Is Responsible for Inflated Stock Prices
text:
Donald Luskin opines that quantitative easing had no effect on asset prices (“Fed Should Unwind Its Asset Portfolio Quickly,” Letters, Jan. 18). He asserts that “if for some reason an investor, who had sold his Treasury bonds to the Fed, decided to use the cash proceeds to buy stocks, then some other investor would have to sell those stocks,” allegedly with no effect on prices. Not so fast. When people with cash burning holes in their pockets buy assets, they buy at the asking price. That’s what drives up prices.
Richard...
